name: Ace Library
description: A library module for using the Ace code editor in Foundry VTT.

name: Journal Code Editor
description: A module for Foundry VTT that allows you to modify the source code of your Journal Entries using the editor library of your choice.

name: Atomizer
description: A build and extract tool for FoundryVTT database files.

name: Simultaneous Combat System
description: An implementation of the Simultaneous Combat System for Foundry VTT.

name: Default Context Menu
description: Use the default browser context menu in Foundry VTT.

name: Export Sheet to PDF
description: A system agnostic tool to export your Foundry character sheet to a PDF!

name: Combat Tracker Groups
description: Group combatants in the Combat Tracker and roll for group initiative.

name: Sidebar Macros
description: Add a Macros tab to the Foundry VTT sidebar!

name: World Smiths
description: I'm the founder of the World Smiths Discord server where the community creates Foundry VTT worlds together.

name: Module Compatibility Checker
description: Check your module list for compatibility with the latest major version of Foundry VTT.

name: Custom Fonts
description: Facilitates using Custom Fonts in Journal Entries, Text Drawings on the canvas, or for the entire UI! You can upload your own font or load a font directly from Google Fonts. This module inspired the core developers to add the ability to use custom fonts in Foundry VTT.

name: Persist Sheets
description: This module stores your opened sheets and it will reopen, resize, and re-arrange them after you reload or restart Foundry VTT.

name: Adventure Tiers
description: Set up your Adventure for all 4 tiers of players to import different content based on the user's choice.

name: Code Comp
description: Code Comp is a platform for developers to compete against each other in a variety of coding challenges. Project for SEG 2900 at uOttawa.

name: uORocketry website
description: The website for the uOttawa Rocketry team.

name: Hack the Hill website
description: Contributed to the website for Hack the Hill, a hackathon organized by uOttawa students. I worked on the development, design, and infrastructure for the website including building a CLI for sending emails to participants.

name: Zap!
description: Remove or hide anything from the interface of your Foundry VTT game.
